Package Server

Class DatabaseManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server.DatabaseManager
  • public class DatabaseManager
extends java.lang.Object
    DatabaseManager handles all database operations for the chat system. It provides persistent storage for chat messages and user accounts using SQLite database.

    This class manages:

    • Database connection and initialization
    • Creating the messages and users table structures
    • User registration with SHA-256 password hashing
    • User authentication with password verification
    • Checking username existence
    • Inserting new messages into the database
    • Retrieving message history for users

    Database Schema: 

     CREATE TABLE messages (
   id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
   sender TEXT NOT NULL,
   sender_ip TEXT NOT NULL,
   recipient TEXT NOT NULL,
   recipient_ip TEXT NOT NULL,
   content TEXT NOT NULL,
   timestamp TEXT NOT NULL
 );
 
 CREATE TABLE users (
   id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
   username TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
   password_hash TEXT NOT NULL,
   created_at TEXT NOT NULL
 );
    Version:
    2.2
    Author:
    ChatSystem Team
    See Also:
    ChatServer, ClientHandler

    • Method Detail

      • insertMessage

        public static void insertMessage​(java.lang.String sender,
                                 java.lang.String sender_ip,
                                 java.lang.String recipient,
                                 java.lang.String recipient_ip,
                                 java.lang.String content,
                                 java.lang.String timestamp)
        Inserts a new message into the database. This method is called for all public messages (not private messages or commands).
        Parameters:
        sender - the username of the message sender
        content - the text content of the message
        timestamp - the timestamp of the message in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss format

      • getAllMessages

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllMessages​(java.lang.String username)
        Retrieves all messages from the database in chronological order. This method is called when a new user joins to display message history.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of formatted message strings in the format: "[timestamp] sender: content"

      • createUsersTable

        public static void createUsersTable()
        Creates the users table if it doesn't exist Stores username and hashed password for authentication

      • registerUser

        public static boolean registerUser​(java.lang.String username,
                                   java.lang.String password)
        Registers a new user with username and password.
        Parameters:
        username - the username to register
        password - the plain text password (will be hashed before storing)
        Returns:
        true if registration successful, false if username already exists

      • verifyPassword

        public static boolean verifyPassword​(java.lang.String username,
                                     java.lang.String password)
        Verifies if a password matches the stored hash for a user.
        Parameters:
        username - the username to check
        password - the plain text password to verify
        Returns:
        true if password matches, false otherwise

      • userExists

        public static boolean userExists​(java.lang.String username)
        Checks if a username exists in the database.
        Parameters:
        username - the username to check
        Returns:
        true if user exists, false otherwise
